Crimes.Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of the decision not to reopen the refugee claim
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Failure to comply with procedural requirements for reopening a claim
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicant's intent to misuse refugee status for work undermines credibility
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Procedural omissions (lack of fixed address, late PIF submission)
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Subsection 72(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Request to reopen abandoned refugee claim
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Failure to provide fixed address and notify legal representation
Crimes.Application_Error: Late submission of PIF; failure to maintain contact information
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Breach of natural justice required to reopen a claim
Crimes.Application_Factor: Intent to use refugee protection for employment purposes
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Was the refusal to reopen the claim reasonable?
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Section 72(1), Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: PIF not received due to late submission and lack of valid address
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: No breach of natural justice found due to applicant’s omissions
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Applicant’s motive to obtain work authorization affected credibility
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge based on alleged unfairness in claim abandonment
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Failure to meet notification and address requirements
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to provide fixed address and counsel information
